pageContext.claim: “I say what the hell is going on? And then, they said I had a massive heart attack, nothing to joke about. But they said I had a massive heart attack. I had a heart attack and it wasn't true. They knew it wasn't true. They were with me. If you've had a heart attack, you don't leave the hospital shortly after you get that.”
pageContext.analysis: Mainstream media did not claim Trump had a massive heart attack. The mysterious nature of Trump's unannounced visit to Walter Reed hospital, supposedly for a routine check-up just nine months after his last one, naturally raised questions given the White House's tendency to shade the truth. "We know that Trump is 73 years old, has heart disease and is clinically obese," wrote Dr. Sanjay Gupta, CNN's chief medical correspondent. "For any man of that age and medical history, an unexpected visit to the hospital is concerning."
